Data.event_text: 7 January  Five people are killed more than 30 others are rescued after a boat capsizes along the Niger River in Anambra State.

links.text: -"Five die as boat capsizes in River Niger". PM News Nigeria. 2024-01-07. Retrieved 2024-01-07.-

Data.event_text: 8 January  A two-year BBC investigation accuses the Synagogue Church of All Nations founder T. B. Joshua of rape and torture.

links.text: -"TB Joshua: Megachurch leader raped and tortured worshippers, BBC finds". 2024-01-08. Retrieved 2024-01-08.-

Data.event_text: 9 January  At least 20 people are feared dead after an accident involving two passenger boats.

links.text: -"At least 20 feared dead in Nigeria boat accident, officials say". Reuters. 2024-01-10. Retrieved 2024-01-11.-

Data.event_text: Bandits attack soldiers at a military base in Nahuta, Katsina State.

links.text: -"Residents Flee In Ex-President Buhari's Katsina State As Terrorists Sack Nigerian Military Base". saharareporters.com. Retrieved 2024-01-16.-

Data.event_text: Eight people are killed and 100 others are reported missing after a boat capsizes along the boundary of Niger and Kebbi States.

links.text: -"Eight dead and an estimated 100 people missing after the latest Nigeria boat accident". Africanews. 16 January 2024. Retrieved 2024-01-16.-

Data.event_text: 17 January  Two people are killed and 77 others injured during a blast caused by explosives stored for use in illegal mining operations at a dozen buildings in Ibadan.

links.text: -"3 killed and 77 injured in a massive blast caused by explosives in a southern Nigerian city". AP News. 2024-01-17. Retrieved 2024-01-17.-

Data.event_text: 24 January  At least 30 people are killed during an attack by armed men in the village of Kwahaslalek, Plateau State.

links.text: -Abraham, James (2024-01-24). "Gunmen kill 30 in fresh Plateau attack". Punch Newspapers. Retrieved 2024-01-25.-

Data.event_text: Nigeria loses 21 against Ivory Coast in the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations final held in Abidjan.

links.text: -Johnson, Jonathan (11 February 2024). "Ivory Coast fight back to edge Nigeria and win AFCON 2023 after firing coach mid tournament". CBS Sports. Archived from the original on 11 February 2024. Retrieved 12 February 2024.-

-Johnson, Jonathan (11 February 2024). "Ivory Coast fight back to edge Nigeria and win AFCON 2023 after firing coach mid tournament". CBS Sports. Archived from the original on 11 February 2024. Retrieved 12 February 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 March  Kuriga kidnapping More than 200 pupils and a teacher are kidnapped in the town of Kuriga, Chikun Local Government Area, Kaduna State
22 March  14 people are rescued from kidnappers by the Nigerian Army and local vigilante groups in Katsina State.

links.text: -"Security Agents Rescue Abducted Passengers In Katsina". March 22, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 March  Kuriga kidnapping The pupils kidnapped on  from schools in Kuriga are freed.

links.text: -"Kuriga kidnap: Nigerian pupils taken in mass abduction freed". BBC News. 2024-03-24. Retrieved 2024-03-25.-

Data.event_text: 18 April  A schoolgirl who was abducted during the Chibok kidnapping in 2014 is rescued by authorities along with her three children in Gwoza, Borno State.

links.text: -"A Nigerian schoolgirl abducted by extremists 10 years ago is rescued pregnant, with 3 kids". Africanews. 2024-04-18. Retrieved 2024-04-19.-

Data.event_text: 19 April  Six soldiers are killed and two others are injured in an ambush during anti-bandit operations in Shiroro, Niger State.

links.text: -"Six soldiers killed during an operation against bandits in Nigeria". Africanews. 2024-04-23. Retrieved 2024-04-23.-

Data.event_text: 24 April  A total of 118 inmates escape from a prison in Suleja after heavy rains destroy its perimeter fence.

links.text: -"More than 100 inmates break free from a Nigerian prison after heavy rains". Associated Press. 2024-04-25. Retrieved 2024-04-25.-

Data.event_text: 10 May  Nine students are abducted by gunmen from the Confluence University of Science and Technology in Osara, Kogi State.

links.text: -"Gunmen abduct 9 students in Nigeria's north in the latest attack targeting schools". Associated Press. 11 May 2024. Retrieved 11 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 May  Eight people are killed in an attack on a mosque in Gadan, Kano State.

links.text: -"Mosque attack in northern Nigeria leaves 8 people dead". Africanews. 16 May 2024. Retrieved 16 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 20 May  At least 40 people are killed in an attack on the village of Zurak in Wase, Plateau State.

links.text: -"At least 40 villagers shot dead in latest violence in Nigeria's conflict-hit north". Associated Press. 22 May 2024. Retrieved 22 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: Authorities rescue 350 Boko Haram hostages in the Sambisa Forest in Borno State.

links.text: -"Hundreds of hostages, mostly women and children, are rescued from Boko Haram extremists in Nigeria". Associated Press. 22 May 2024. Retrieved 22 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: Seven students are killed after inhaling fumes from a generator overnight inside a music studio in Yenagoa, Bayelsa State.

links.text: -"Generator fumes kill seven university students in Nigeria". Africanews. 22 May 2024. Retrieved 22 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 24 May  Ten people are killed while 160 others are abducted in an attack by suspected Boko Haram militants on the village of Kuchi in Niger State.

links.text: -"Some 160 villagers reported taken in deadly raid". BBC. 26 May 2024. Retrieved 26 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 May  Nigeria readopts Nigeria, We Hail Thee, which was the country's national anthem from 1960 to 1978, as its national anthem, replacing Arise, O Compatriots.

links.text: -"Outrage as Nigeria changes national anthem". BBC. 29 May 2024. Retrieved 29 May 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 May  2024 Aba killings Eleven people, including five soldiers, are killed in an attack on a military checkpoint by unknown gunmen in Aba, Abia State.

links.text: -"Soldiers among 11 killed by separatist militants in southeast Nigeria". Associated Press. 31 May 2024. Retrieved 1 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: A strike by the Nigerian Labour Congress and the Trade Union Congress of Nigeria disrupts operations at Abuja and Lagos Airports and causes nationwide power outages.

links.text: -"Nigeria loses electricity and major airports close as unions seek higher wages amid record inflation". Associated Press. 4 June 2024. Retrieved 4 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: Thirty miners are reported trapped after a gold mine collapses in Galadima Kogo, Niger State.

links.text: -"Dozens of gold miners trapped in Nigeria". BBC. 5 June 2024. Retrieved 6 June 2024.-

Data.event_text: 10 June Nigerian bandit conflict At least 50 people are killed and an unknown number are kidnapped, including women and children, after gunmen attack the village of Yargoje in Katsina State.

links.text: -"Nigeria gunmen kill 50 in raid on northwest village". June 10, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 22 June At least seven people are killed and 100 others are kidnapped after gunmen attack the village of Maidabino in Katsina State.

links.text: -"Seven dead, dozens missing after attack in northern Nigeria". Al Jazeera. June 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 June  2024 Borno State bombings A series of bombings in Borno State kill 18 people and injure 30 others.

links.text: -"Borno: At least 18 killed in northern Nigeria blasts". BBC News. 2024-06-29. Retrieved 2024-06-30.-

Data.event_text: 12 July  2024 Saints Academy college collapse At least 22 students are killed and 132 others injured after a school building collapses in Jos, Plateau State.

links.text: -"The collapse of a school in northern Nigeria leaves 22 students dead, officials say". Associated Press. 13 July 2024. Retrieved 13 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 July  The Nigeria Labour Congress, the Trade Union Congress, and the Nigerian government agree on a new minimum wage of â‚¦70,000 (US$43) per month, ending prolonged negotiations amid high inflation and a weakening currency.

links.text: -"Nigerian president to hike minimum wage as living costs rise". France 24. 19 July 2024. Retrieved 19 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 26 July11 August  Nigeria at the 2024 Summer Olympics

links.text: -"Nigeria sports under scrutiny after 'disastrous' Olympics". France 24. 13 August 2024. Retrieved 13 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 28 July  A court in Niger State convicts 125 people on charges of membership and financing of Boko Haram following a two-day mass trial and sentences them to varying prison terms.

links.text: -"Nigeria court convicts 125 Boko Haram Islamist militants in mass trial". Africanews. 28 July 2024. Retrieved 28 July 2024.-

Data.event_text: 31 July  Sixteen people are killed and at least 24 others are injured in a bomb attack on a market in Kawori, Borno State.

links.text: -"16 people killed and dozens critically wounded in bombing in Nigeria's Borno state, officials say". Associated Press. 1 August 2024. Retrieved 2 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 Augustongoing  End Bad Governance protests Eleven people are killed, and one journalist is arrested as nationwide protests occur amidst a cost-of-living crisis and rising costs, which Nigerians blame on President Bola Tinubu's new reforms. A curfew is declared in Kano, Jigawa, Yobe and Katsina States in response to the violence.

links.text: -"Hundreds protest across Nigeria over soaring cost of living, fuel prices". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-08-01.-
-"Nigerians hit with 24-hour curfews amid protests". BBC. 2 August 2024. Retrieved 2024-08-02.-

Data.event_text: 5 August  Seven Polish students and faculty of the University of Warsaw are arrested in Kano State on suspicion of displaying Russian flags during protests. They are released on 28 August.

links.text: -"Nigeria detains Polish students and a lecturer for allegedly displaying Russian flags during protest". Associated Press. 2024-08-08. Retrieved 2024-08-08.-
-"6 Polish students and a lecturer freed from detention in Nigeria, foreign ministry in Warsaw says". Associated Press. 2024-08-28. Retrieved 2024-08-28.-

Data.event_text: 6 August  Police detain tailors who made Russian flags that were used in anti-government protests in Kano State.

links.text: -"Nigeria detains tailors who made Russian flags for anti-government protests". Reuters. August 6, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 7 August  A boat sinks following an engine explosion in Bayelsa State, killing at least 20 people.

links.text: -"Tragic boat engine explosion in southern Nigeria kills at least 20, raises regulatory concerns". Associated Press. August 9, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 August  At least 20 students of the University of Maiduguri and the University of Jos are abducted by unidentified gunmen along the Otukpo road in Benue State. They are subsequently freed on 23 August.

links.text: -"20 Nigerian students abducted by gunmen in an ambush in the north". Associated Press. August 17, 2024.-
-"Police say 20 abducted Nigerian medical students freed". Al Jazeera. August 24, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 21 August  At least 13 farmers are killed by unidentified gunmen in Niger State.

links.text: -"Armed men kill at least 13 farmers in Nigeria's conflict-hit region, official says". Associated Press. August 23, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 August  Two police officers are killed and three others are injured in an attack in Abuja. A police spokesperson says that the proscribed Islamic Movement of Nigeria was responsible for the attack.

links.text: -"Two Nigerian police officers killed in attack by Islamist group, say police". Reuters. August 25, 2024.-

Data.event_text: A one-week nationwide doctors' strike begins in protest over the abduction of one of their members, Ganiyat Popoola, who remains in captivity after being kidnapped in Kaduna in December 2023.

links.text: -"Doctors strike in Nigeria over kidnapped colleague". BBC. August 26, 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least 49 people are killed and more than 40,000 people are displaced by flooding caused by heavy rains in Adamawa, Jigawa, and Taraba States.

links.text: -"Floods in Nigeria kill at least 49, displace thousands". Al Jazeera. Retrieved 2024-08-27.-

Data.event_text: 27 August  The United States donates 10,000 doses of mpox vaccines to Nigeria, making it the first African country to receive them.

links.text: -"Nigeria becomes first African country to obtain Mpox vaccines". Africanews. August 29, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 31 August  Chidimma Adetshina, who withdrew from the Miss Universe South Africa 2024 competition due to racist abuse, is crowned as Miss Universe Nigeria 2024, defeating 24 other contestants.
1 September  Tarmuwa massacre At least 130 people are killed after a Boko Haram attack on Tarmuwa, Yobe State.

links.text: -"Boko Haram militants on motorcycles attacked a Nigerian village, killing over 100, residents say". Associated Press. 2024-09-04. Retrieved 2024-09-04.-

Data.event_text: 8 September  At least 52 people and 50 cattle are killed in an explosion caused by a collision between a fuel tanker and a truck in Agaie, Niger State.

links.text: -"Fuel tanker explosion in Nigeria kills at least 52 people". RTE. 2024-09-09. Retrieved 2024-09-09.-

Data.event_text: 9 September  The State Security department arrests Joe Ajaero, the leader of the Nigeria Labour Congress, at Abuja Airport, days after he criticised the Nigerian government for raising gas prices.

links.text: -"Nigeria: Main labor union says its leader has been arrested". dw.com. Retrieved 2024-09-09.-

Data.event_text: 10 September  2024 Alau Dam collapse The Alau Dam collapses in Borno State following heavy rains, resulting in floods that inundate 15% of the state capital Maiduguri. and killing more than 80% of animals in the Sanda Kyarimi Park Zoo. At least 30 people are reported killed due to flooding in the area.

links.text: -"Dam collapse in Nigeria sweeps deadly reptiles into flooded communities". Associated Press. 2024-09-11. Retrieved 2024-09-11.-
-"Floods decimate Nigerian zoo, wash crocodiles into community". Reuters. September 11, 2024.-
-"Flooding in northeastern Nigeria has left 30 people dead and over a million displaced". Associated Press. 2024-09-12. Retrieved 2024-09-12.-

Data.event_text: Thirteen people abducted by an unidentified armed group are rescued by the Nigerian Army in Kaduna State.

links.text: -"Nigerian army rescues 13 hostages from extremist group". Associated Press. 2024-09-15. Retrieved 2024-09-15.-

Data.event_text: A boat capsizes near Gummi, Zamfara State, killing at least 40 people.

links.text: -"Boat capsizes in Nigeria, drowning at least 40 people". Al Jazeera. September 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 September  Over 280 inmates are reported to have escaped from a prison in Maiduguri due to damage to prison walls caused by floods.

links.text: -"Nearly 300 prisoners escape Nigerian prison after floods". Reuters. September 15, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 17 September  At least 25 children are killed when a bus carrying Muslims celebrating Mawlid collides with a truck in Lere, Kaduna State.

links.text: -"Nigeria bus crash kills at least 25 children on religious trip". al-Arabiya. September 17, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 30 September  An overloaded boat carrying 300 passengers capsizes along the Niger River in Mokwa, Niger State, leaving at least 11 people dead and more than 100 others missing.

links.text: -"More than 100 people missing after boat capsizes in northern Nigeria". Associated Press. 2024-10-03. Retrieved 2024-10-03.-

Data.event_text: 15 October  At least 170 people are killed and 100 others are injured after an overturned fuel truck explodes while residents were trying to collect its cargo in Majiya, Jigawa State.

links.text: -"'We'll never forget': Town grieves after deadly Nigeria fuel tanker blast". Al Jazeera. 19 October 2024.-

Data.event_text: 16 October  The Senate begins a probe into allegations that personnel of the Department of State Services had taken over the National Assembly Complex in a move to impeach the President of the Senate, Godswill Akpabio.

links.text: -Umoru, Henry (2024-10-16). "Akpabio's impeachment speculation: Senate probes report of DSS invading NASS". Vanguard. Retrieved 2024-10-17.-

Data.event_text: 23 October  President Tinubu implements a cabinet reshuffle that results in the dismissal of the ministers of education, tourism, women's affairs and youth development as well as the junior minister for housing.

links.text: -"Nigeria's President reshuffles cabinet amid historic cost-of-living crisis". Africanews. 2024-10-23. Retrieved 2024-10-24.-

Data.event_text: 24 October  A Sikorsky S-76 helicopter chartered by the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation crashes into the Gulf of Guinea off the coast of Calabar, Cross River State. Five people are killed while the remaining three passengers are reported missing.

links.text: -"Accident Sikorsky S-76C+ 5N-BQG, Thursday 24 October 2024". asn.flightsafety.org. Retrieved 2024-11-01.-

-"OCTOBER 30, 2024 BRIEFING: UPDATE ON HELICOPTER DITCHING ACCIDENT NEAR BONNY FINIMA â€“ FIVE BODIES RECOVERED SO FAR news-release 20241030 - Nigerian Safety Investigation Bureau". Nigerian Safety Investigation Bureau. 30 October 2024. Retrieved 1 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 27 October  A partially-demolished building collapses in Sabon-Lugbe, Abuja, killing seven people.

links.text: -"Building collapse in Nigeria's capital leaves at least 7 dead". Associated Press. 2024-10-28. Retrieved 2024-10-28.-

Data.event_text: 30 October  "Scores" of civilians are killed in an airstrike by the Chadian military on a group of fishermen mistaken to be Boko Haram militants in Tilma island on the Nigerian side of Lake Chad.

links.text: -"Chad's Army Accused Of Killing Scores Of Fishermen In Nigeria". Barron's. 2024-10-31. Retrieved 2024-11-02.-

Data.event_text: 18 November  At least seven members of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps are reported missing following a Boko Haram attack on their convoy in Shiroro, Niger State that also leaves 50 attackers dead.

links.text: -"At least 7 members of Nigerian security force missing after insurgents ambush convoy". Associated Press. 20 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: 29 November  A boat capsizes in the Niger River along the boundary of Kogi and Niger States, killing at least 27 people and leaving 100 others missing.

links.text: -"Nigeria confirms that at least 27 people died and more than 100 are missing after boat capsized". Associated Press. 30 November 2024.-

Data.event_text: The Durbar festival in Kano is recognized by UNESCO as an Intangible cultural heritage.

links.text: -"Eid festivities in north Nigeria make UNESCO heritage list". France 24. 6 December 2024. Retrieved 6 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: Eighteen Nigerians win the prestigious Diana Award for their outstanding social work and contributions to their communities.

links.text: -"Diana Award Roll of Honour". The Diana Award. Retrieved 6 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 8 December  At least 43 people are abducted in an attack by unidentified gunmen on the village of Kafin Dawa, Zamfara State.

links.text: -"Dozens kidnapped by rifle-wielding men in northwest Nigeria village". Al Jazeera. 10 December 2024. Retrieved 10 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 15 December  Two people are killed during clashes between rival factions of the United Methodist Church in Taraba State.

links.text: -"Deadly violence in Nigeria linked to breakup of United Methodist Church over LGBTQ policies". Associated Press. 18 December 2024. Retrieved 18 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 18 December  At least 35 people are killed in a stampede at a religious festival held at an Islamic high school in Ibadan.

links.text: -"Nigeria school fair stampede kills 35 children". Al Jazeera. 20 December 2024. Retrieved 20 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: At least ten people are killed in a stampede at a charity distribution event held at a church in Maitama, Abuja.

links.text: -"Ten people including children die in a stampede in Nigeria at a Christmas food distribution event". Associated Press. 22 December 2024. Retrieved 22 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: Three people are killed in a stampede at a charity distribution event in Okija, Anambra State.

links.text: -"13 people including children die in stampedes in Nigeria at Christmas charity events". Associated Press. 22 December 2024. Retrieved 22 December 2024.-

Data.event_text: 25 December  At least ten civilians are killed in an airstrike in Silame, Sokoto State. The military says it had accidentally hit the victims during an operation against Lakurawa militants.

links.text: -"Airstrike on insurgents mistakenly killed 10 civilians, Nigerian military says". Associated Press. 28 December 2024. Retrieved 28 December 2024.-
